item.title: about me
item.description: current assistant professor (universitair docent 1, UD1) of statistics Econometric Institute, Erasmus School of Economics, Erasmus University Rotterdam past assistant professor (universitair docent 2, UD2) of statistics Econometric Institute, Erasmus School of Economics, Erasmus University Rotterdam research fellow of statistics Department of Law and Economics, UnitelmaSapienza University of Rome education masterclass supervising phd research Erasmus University Rotterdam (2024) dutch university teaching qualification (BKO) Risbo - Erasmus University Rotterdam (2022) phd in methodological statistics at La Sapienza University of Rome (2020) msc in statistics and decision sciences at La Sapienza University of Rome (2016) bsc in statistics at La Sapienza University of Rome (2013) qualifications National Qualification for Associate Professor (Italy, ASN II fascia), Statistics (SC 13/D1, June-2023) awards and grants IFCS Chikio Hayashi award (USD 1,000.

item.title: events
item.description: future conferences 65th ISI World Statistics Congress 2025 (October 05-09, 2025 - The Hague, The Netherlands) International Scientific Joint Meeting of the Italian and Dutch-Flemish Classification Societies (September 08-10, 2025 - Naples, Italy) Data Science, Statistics & Visualisation 2025 (July 07-09, 2025 - Kruger National Park, South Africa) recent events 2024 VOC Jubilee conference (November 21-22, 2024 - Leusden, The Netherlands) 18th Conference of the International Federation and Classification Societies (July 15-17, 2024 - San Jose, Costarica) 52nd Scientific Meeting of the Italian Statistical Society (June 17-20, 2024 - Bari, Italy) 12th VOC conference (March 08, 2024 - Nijmegen, The Netherlands)

item.title: materials and info
item.description: I am a statistician and my research is focused on the methodological and computational aspects of data analysis. The best feeling is when I can use my knowledge to solve practical and real problems. I am currently working on latent variable models, unsupervised classification and model-based composite indicators. ongoing projects software seminars and talks events supervisions and teaching

item.title: ongoing projects
item.description: my current research consists of: Unbiased mixed variables distance (van de Velden, M., Iodice D’Enza, A., Markos, A. and Cavicchia, C.) - Under review - arXiv - SSRN Convex Clustering of Mixed Numerical and Categorical Data (Brink, T. and Cavicchia, C.) Sparse Scaling (Groenen, P.J.F. and Cavicchia, C.) KNN for mixed data (van de Velden, M., Iodice D’Enza, A., Markos, A. and Cavicchia, C.

item.title: publications
item.description: refereed journal articles Willemsen, R., Cavicchia, C., van den Heuvel, W. and van de Velden, M. An Exact Solution Approach for Hierarchical Clustering INFORMS Journal on Computing, (2025) Bottazzi Schenone, M., Cavicchia, C., Vichi, M. and Zaccaria, G. Ultrametric Factor Analysis for building hierarchies of reliable and unidimensional latent concepts Psychometrika, (2025) van de Velden, M., Iodice D’Enza, A., Markos, A. and Cavicchia, C.

item.title: seminars and talks
item.description: seminars and invited talks Distances for mixed data: issues, solutions and a new KNN approach - Seminar at Federico II University of Naples, Dipartimento di Science Economiche e Statistiche (2024 - Naples, Italy) Nearest neighbors for mixed type data: an inter-dependency based approach - IFCS 2024: 18th conference of the International Federation of Classification Societies (2024 - San Jose, Costa Rica) Convex Clustering of Mixed Numerical and Categorical Data - SIS 2024: The 52nd Scientific Meeting of the Italian Statistical Society (2024 - Bari, Italy)

item.title: software
item.description: I am the author and contributor of the following packages An Exact Solution Approach for Hierarchical Clustering manydist PUGMM catdist

item.title: supervisions and teaching
item.description: supervisions I am currently co-supervising - together with Olga Kuryatnikova and Patrick J.F. Groenen - the research internship of Leon Czarnecki within his Business Data Science research MSc. The internship focuses on investigating the applicability of alternating direction method of multipliers (admm) for statistical and data science problems I am currently supervising the BSc Honours Research Class internship of Alexia Chirita. The project focuses on the potential application of a model-based approach to hierarchical clustering
